intro.speaker: Narration
intro.line: The Crimean royal palac, located in the center of Melior, is famed for its beautiful  gardens where the world seems at peace. But times have changed. Countless battles have raged in these idyllic confines, and a new dark lord now sits upon the throne. The palace itself has not suffered--it remains a study in dignity and elegance. Yet there is no peace on this day. A grim tension fills the air, engulfing all it touches in deafening silence. Within the heart of the palace sits the author of this war: Ashnard, king of Daein.

intro.speaker: Narration
intro.line: Ike, supreme commander of the Crimean army, and Elincia, princess of Crimea, have completed their battle preparations. Now, they spend a tense morning waiting for the decisive battle that will conclude their yearlong odyssey. They wait for the beginning of the end.

intro.speaker: Bastian
intro.line: Princess? It's time.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: It's right there... I can see the capital...Father, Mother, my lord Uncle...Your Elincia has returned...

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Our soldiers are in formation and awaiting your word, Princess. For good or ill, this will be our final battle. Before they march, would you...speak to them?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: What? Y-y-you want me to...address the troops?

intro.speaker: Geoffrey
intro.line: This fight will determine if Ashnard falls and if we can all return to our beloved homeland. Today, Princess, we risk all. Giving men the courage to fight is the duty of a leader.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I...I don't know how well I'll do, but...I will try.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...Ahem!...Hear me! Brave fighting men of Crimea! Much have you lost in service to your land.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Hear me! Beloved friends of the laguz! You, too, have given all for our fair cause. Hear me! My trusted company of old! You men of Greil did see me to this day.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I stand before you made of flesh and bone, alive because you risked your lives for me. A word cannot my thanks express in kind...

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: We march today into the jaws of fate; our enemy lies in wait o'er this hill. If on the 'morrow, Ashnard lives no more, my fondest dream is to among you walk and give you each my heartfelt thanks anew.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Let not this dream dissolve into dispair! We will defeat the dreaded king of Daein! We will reclaim this land we hold so dear. Lend me your strength! Lend me your weary hearts! Today we make our fate for good and all. One life can make a mark upon this world. One life can move the wheel of history. Be that one life! Fight well! Fight brave! Fight true.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: ...Where did that come from?! That was magnificent! It seems the princess, too, has grown stronger.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It's said we grow into the roles we're given, isn't it? Elincia will make a splendid queen.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That's... That's just what Nasir said! What? It's true! Stop it! Don't give me that I-can't-believe-what-I-just-heard look.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Nasir said it, right? Whew! That's a relief! I thought the world had gone mad.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...Stupid cat.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right, let's go! This ends today!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: I'm ready.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I have everything I need.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Very well, we're ready--

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Say, Ike! This is the end of the end, you know? So...rather than just giving orders... Why don't you say a word, too?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I think Princess Elincia said enough!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: I want to hear what you have to say, Brother! Father always did it, didn't he?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You want me to say something...like Father would have done?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Uh-huh!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Um...hey there...Before this final battle, there's only one thing I want to tell all of you...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I don't want any of you dying on me! Remember--you only have one life! At a time like this, it doesn't matter what our blood ties are. We are family. That's what my father always used to say. And today...for the first time... I understand why he said it... Because we are a family.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So if you don't want to cause your family any grief, then live! Don't drop your guard! Don't turn your back! Use every drop of your strength! Our road has been long, but it ends today! Let's liberate Crimea and free our friends...and our families...from Daein's tyranny! Men of Crimea...Laguz of Tellius...Greil Mercenaries...MOVE OUT!!

intro.speaker: Unknown
intro.line: Attack! We're being attacked!

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: The castle gate has fallen! The Crimean army cannot be stopped!

intro.speaker: Bryce
intro.line: ...It appears the end is near. Your Majesty, please use the rear gate and withdraw. We will cover your retreat.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: I am not leaving.

intro.speaker: Bryce
intro.line: But if... If we lose Your Majesty, the Daein royal bloodline itself will be lost!

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Are you saying I will lose? Hm? Is that what you wish to say?

intro.speaker: Bryce
intro.line: ...Of course not! However, our army is in dire straits. It is merely an act of prudence, Your Majesty. I humbly ask that you consider the continuance of the bloodline above all else. Of course, your judgment--

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: The value of the thirteenth generation of Daein's royal family is not so high as to warrant your pathetic display. I AM Daein. If I am to be destroyed, then let Daein be destroyed with me.

intro.speaker: Bryce
intro.line: Your... Your Majesty... That is--

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: I have no need of inconstant retainers. You are an obstacle. Away with you.

intro.speaker: Bryce
intro.line: ...B-but, Your Majesty...

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: My sole desire is to rule through strength. The weak perish, and the strong live on... This is the law of nature. It is the law the goddess herself created when she forged this world.

intro.speaker: Bryce
intro.line: ...It appears that further conversation would only be a waste of time. Though even if His Majesty desires it not, I will remain and protect him. I cannot allow the legacy of Daein to end here!

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Tell me, Bryce... You were my father's retainer, were you not?

intro.speaker: Bryce
intro.line: ...From the fifteenth year of my life...and for twenty more years until his death... I did serve him faithfully.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: The thing that killed my father was not plague, nor was it another illness.  It was me.

intro.speaker: Bryce
intro.line: Wh-what?

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Oh, but it doesn't end there. There was my stepmother, too. And every brother who stood to be a legitimate heir...All of them died by my hand.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Are you still determined to protect me? Knowing this truth?

intro.speaker: Bryce
intro.line: ...I am...Even knowing now as I do...you are still your father's son. The blood of Daein's kings flows in you. You are all that remains....By your leave.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Such loyalty to a corpse...In truth, there is nothing in this world more humorous than a knight.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Hey! Look out!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Is... Is that...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Elincia, what are you doing?! Get back!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...Ashnard...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Wh-what did you say? THAT is the king of Daein?!

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Heh heh heh heh...It's been a long time, Princess Crimea.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: You look quite different than you did the day that I cut your father and mother down like cattle... I can hardly believe you're the same little girl who did nothing but tremble and stare at me.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: You... You craven-- I've returned to see you defeated! I will no longer allow you to treat Crimea any way you please!

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Haaa haa haa! How brave and noble of you. However, you are not the one I seek.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Aaah!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Elincia!

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Are you the one they claim is the son of Gawain?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: King Ashnard of Daein! Your treachery dies on my blade!

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: Oh ho? Ah ha ha ha haaaa! I see that blade in your hand... It is a sacred blade, is it not? The only type of blade that can pierce my armor. Hm. It matters not how famous the blade. If the wielder lacks skill, the greatest sword is nothing but blunted steel.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Don't worry. You will see for yourself how blunt it is.

intro.speaker: Ashnard
intro.line: I expect good things from you, son of Gawain. What you see before you are my elite, handpicked soldiers. How will you deal with them? I'm looking forward to watching you. Don't disappoint me!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Hold!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Any of you whose arms remember what it is like to battle, step forth! I would take of your strength now!

battle.speaker: Nasir
battle.line: Ike! We can't win like this! Call one of the battalion commanders! Do it now!

battle.speaker: Giffca
battle.line: I have arrived. What is that thing? So...Ashnard tried to use the medallion, did he?...Fool...

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: Sorry to have kept you waiting...Is that King Daein?! He's become a monster! The medallion's chaotic energy is overflowing from his body....No matter. Leave him to me. I promise you this! Ashnard will fall at my hands.

battle.speaker: Naesala
battle.line: ...Yeah, yeah, I'm here... What's everyone so worked up abou--Holy goddess above!!! Is that thing...King Daein? H-he's a monster! Wait... You want me to fight THAT? Are you insane?!

boss.speaker: Bryce
boss.line: I am Bryce, general of Daein!

boss.speaker: Ashnard
boss.line: Heh heh...excellent...Excellent! So good! More...more, I say! At this time of ascension, it's not enough...not enough...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Ena, stay back! The king's mount is still alive!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What's going on? His mount is so calm...

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: That...is her mate. As death nears, he has regained his sanity.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: A laguz... No, it can't be. Ashnard's mount was a wyvern...Wasn't it?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Be patient, please. There's something we want to try.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Leanne told me that dragon's true form had been warped. So we sang the galdr of rebirth...

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: ...Rajaion? D-do you know who I am?

end.speaker: Rajaion
end.line: You were made...to suffer...because of me... I'm sorry.

end.speaker: Rajaion
end.line: ...Ena... Let's return to Goldoa. The two of us...together.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: I will go anywhere, my love, as long as it is with you.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: He was one of the dragon tribe?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: That's right. He and Ena were engaged to be married...And then, he was driven mad by King Daein, and his form warped.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What is it, Mist? Did you find something?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: The medallion, Ike! The medallion! I finally...have it back...

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: The medallion belongs in Serenes Forest. My mother...was only holding it for Lillia.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Thank you, daughter of Elena. In the memory of my departed sister...I accept the medallion from you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I've brought her, Nasir.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: ...I'm sorry, Mist.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: I knew how much the medallion meant to you, and I stole it nevertheless. No matter the words I use to apologize, I did something unforgivable. I gained your trust--and Ike's--and betrayed it. Then I compounded my dishonor by fleeing. ...I am so very sorry...

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: ... Thanks for coming back, Nasir. I... I wanted to see you again. And I'm glad I did. Welcome back.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: ...Ah, Mist. I do not deserve your kindness...

conversation.speaker: Ena
conversation.line: ...Mist, please allow me to apologize as well. I am the one who is truly at fault here. What Nasir did, he did for me.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: I'm sure there's some very important reason for all of this. And it's probably still unresolved. I'm honestly quite curious. Plus, I want to help! But... But I doubt that I can. So, I'm going to wait. I've decided to wait until the two of you can tell me about whatever it is. So...you don't need to worry about it anymore. All right?

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: ...Thank you, Mist.

conversation.speaker: Ena
conversation.line: Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: Har! So tomorrow's the day we take on the capital. I'm ready! Whooooo! It doesn't matter how hard the fight you're facing might be, I always feel excited the night before!

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: I'd like to tell you how wrong that is, but I can't. I...can't seem to calm my nerves, either.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: We're going to win, you know? King Daein won't survive the day.

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: Mmm...I wonder.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Are you two on guard duty?

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: Oh, it's you. Heya, Ike.

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: Do you have some need of the king?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yeah, will you tell him I'm here?

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: We will. Wait here.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: So, tomorrow it is. Did you come by to check on our preparations?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You know me too well. You're going to circle the capital and ensure that no airborne enemies escape. That's clear, isn't it?

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: Yes. I think encircling the capital's a good idea. We'll guard the west and take care of airborne combat as well. The Phoenicis and Kilvas armies are unbeatable in that regard.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Kilvas is going to help out?

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: Of course.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: After what we saw in the dungeons of Gritnea Tower, we all agreed that King Ashnard must pay. Reyson and Leanne helped to sway certain opinions. It was tough, but in the end, we understood what needs to happen. That having been said, the crows are traitorous by nature. If worse comes to worst, it may be just us hawks out there.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That will be enough. At least I know I can rely on you.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: Well, to be perfectly honest...I wouldn't mind a chance to remove Ashnard's head from his shoulders.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It's just like the time I fought the Black Knight...You're being kept away from the main fight. My apologies, hawk king.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: That's all right. But if you find yourself overwhelmed, give me a call.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Understood.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: And as for you, Reyson. I'm sure you're tired of hearing this, but--

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: I know, I know. Be careful. Don't die. Don't worry, I won't die. I'm not going to leave Leanne and my father all alone.

conversation.speaker: Nealuchi
conversation.line: Nestling. It appears they're discussing tomorrow's battle. Shouldn't you join them?

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: ...No, I think not. It's just Tibarn after all. He doesn't really want help from Kilvas anyway.

conversation.speaker: Nealuchi
conversation.line: The hawk king may not care, but...Prince Reyson would surely feel that you had betrayed him yet again, Nestling.

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: What?

conversation.speaker: Nealuchi
conversation.line: Oh, and dear lady Leanne as well. If you were to flee in the face of the enemy, it would break her heart. Hah...... It would be so sad...HAAAH... Heeee!

conversation.speaker: Naesala
conversation.line: Senile old crow. You think if you bring those two into it, I'll do as I've been told and fight... Curse you!

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: This war has been waged for over a year...But it could all be over by midday tomorrow. How do you feel, Ike? Think we'll win?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: We'll win.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: I knew you'd say that! Ha! You don't fool me anymore. But even so...I appreciate your bravado tonight.

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: Without such courage, it would be impossible to face King Daein.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Master Giffca! What are you doing here?

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: The king felt uneasy knowing you were here on your own. I come in his name.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: So, are you going to fight with us?

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: That is my purpose. That is, if Lord Ike grants his permission.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Of course. The Daein army is large, so we're going to be attacking them from the front and holding the two eastern gates. I'd be very appreciative if you would agree to take command of that front.

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: If that is your wish, I can but agree.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: What's this now? You weren't satisfied with the work I was doing? I mean, I know that I'm no Master Giffca, but please...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Ranulf, I want you to be with me. Is that all right?

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Oh, now I see. Sure, that would be fine! Getting to be part of the main pack is the highest of honors.

conversation.speaker: Mordecai
conversation.line: Master Giffca!

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: It's been a long time. How is the king?

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: He's in good health. The king...has given me a message for you two.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: A message? Not orders?

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: That's right. He said to be sure you make it home alive. And then he said that your work in the past year has been most satisfactory and that he's sincerely grateful to you both.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: ...That's...such an honor!

conversation.speaker: Mordecai
conversation.line: We have fought hard. But...it wasn't a bother. Ike and the others are good beorc... We are happy to fight with them.

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: I see.
